KnowledgeBase.Title: Example substringGE 001
KnowledgeBase.HumanKeywords: compare string equal boolean case-insensitive substring greater

Example.Description: These examples use the substringGE function to see if the first substring is greater than or equal to the second substring and return the Boolean value, true or false. In these examples, a case-insensitive comparison is done with the substrings. This function does a case-sensitive comparison of the two substrings.

Syntax.Note: Compares "central" in X and "Jurrasic" in Y .
